result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Temporary Restraining Order

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marshall Anthony Green

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Marshall Anthony Green appeared by video.  Attorney Theodore OReilly appeared by video for Marshall Anthony Green.  Attorney Katie Bakunowicz appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Scheduling conference held. For reasons stated on the record, defense counsel requests an additional scheduling conference. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Marshall Anthony Green appeared by video.  Attorney Theodore OReilly appeared by video for Marshall Anthony Green.  Attorney Katie Bakunowicz in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Scheduling conference held. Defense counsel requests an additional scheduling conference. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Marshall Anthony Green appeared by video.  Attorney Theodore OReilly appeared by video for Marshall Anthony Green.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for Status Conference. Discussion with parties. Defense counsel requests case be set  for a Scheduling Conference date, to track along with pending felony matter . Case adjourned to Br 29.
Scheduling conference scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 08-30-2022

Defendant Marshall Anthony Green in court.  Tristan J. Bednarek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Status Conference. The PD's Office needs additional time to appoint counsel. Court orders matter adjourned for a status of counsel hearing in Branch 29.  Status conference scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Marshall Anthony Green not in court, defendant in custody.  Lisa M Valenti-Jordan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Pre-trial conference held. The PD's Office needs additional time to appoint counsel. Court orders matter adjourned for a status of counsel hearing in Branch 29.  Status conference scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with MMM (12/5/00)
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Marshall Anthony Green in court with attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons.  Defendant Marshall Anthony Green in custody.  Kenneth Olstinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Marshall Anthony Green appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  This hearing may be streamed live at the discretion of the Court via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
